page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area under study is situated two and three quarter kilometers to the South East of Wrexham town centre. The countryside is generally undulating towards the river Dee lying two kilometers to the East. A large percentage of the area is taken up by the Wrexham Industrial Estate, surrounded by open farmland with small areas of woodland. The farms are on the whole substantial houses with compact farm buildings and constructed of red brick with slate roofs. The Industrial estate, situated 5km from the town centre was commenced after W.W.2 on the site of an old Royal Ordanance Factory. the estate has been managed by the Welsh Development Agency since 1976 when it was designated a special development area.
